summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Specifies the intended lighting conditions for viewing a video source. This enumeration is used with the AVEncVideoInputColorLighting and AVEncVideoOutputColorLighting properties.

member.name: eAVEncVideoColorLighting.eAVEncVideoColorLighting_SameAsSource
member.summary: Use the same lighting as the input video. This flag applies to the AVEncVideoOutputColorLighting property only.

member.name: eAVEncVideoColorLighting.eAVEncVideoColorLighting_Office
member.summary: Medium brightness; for example, normal office lighting.

member.name: eAVEncVideoColorLighting.eAVEncVideoColorLighting_Dim
member.summary: Dim; for example, a living room with a television and additional low lighting.

member.name: eAVEncVideoColorLighting.eAVEncVideoColorLighting_Dark
member.summary: Dark; for example, a movie theater.
